intro: Endlicheria dysodantha, commonly known as the Malabar thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that contain seeds, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological study.
